intro: Erigeron siculus, commonly known as Sicilian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron siculus is often used in ecological landscaping due to its hardiness and ability to support pollinators.
